captions.text: family,

never forgetting
where we came from.
Thank you, Charlene.

See, you are what
you are in this world,

that's either one
of two things.
Either you're somebody,

or you're nobody.
Be right back.

I need these fresh. 'Cause if I
have to come back here and get you,

- you know what it is.
- Tango.

- Don't y'all play that.
- Yes, sir, I hear you.

You won't have to come back.
There won't be no problem.

What about you,
Frank? You need anything?

Where's my money?
Redtop gave you the package.

You're supposed to be
handing me my money.

Here's a jar right here.
Twenty percent.

- Oh, you got the jar?
- That's right.

Get the fuck out of here...
Oh! What you gonna do?

What the fuck you gonna do,
Frank? Huh? What you doing?

You gonna shoot me in front of
everybody? Huh? Come on.
Shit.

There you go.
Twenty percent.
So, what was I saying?

comments.text:
*Mafia (or Mafioso) is a word exclusive to Italians*. Crimes families 
currently operating in America, from east to west, are as follows: Bonanno, 
Colombo, Gambino, Genovese, Lucchese, Magaddino, DeCavalcante, Bruno, 
Bufalino, LaRocca, Patriarca, Colosimo, Zerilli, Civella, Giordano, 
Porrello, Baltistrieri, Trafficante, Marcello, Civello, Dragna, Cerrito, 
and Colacurcio. *There is no such thing as the Russian, Irish, Jewish, 
Greek, or Chinese mafia*. Because they are not Italian, the word Mafia to 
describe them is a misnomer. Rather, any organized crime outfit that is not 
Italian is called The Mob ... which also applies to Italians, who can be 
Mafia, gangsters and mobsters, yet no other heritage can be Mafia. Frank 
Lucas was a gangster; a high powered drug lord that ran a cartel ... much 
like the fictional film character Tony Montana in Scarface. Lucas was not 
Mafia, in which you must be Italian to be made ... otherwise you are merely 
an associate, and will remain one because you can go no further.﻿

comments.text:
Goodfellers, casino, godfathers are fictional. Meaning in truth not 
realistic. American Gangster is based on Frank Lucas life﻿
comments.author: Van Henderson

comments.text:
+Van Henderson Goodfellas and Casino ARE based on actual events and 
specific people. Goodfellas is based on members of the Luchesse crime 
family in New York ... Paul Vario, Jimmy Burke, Henry Hill and Tommy 
DeSimone ... the murder of Billy "Bats" Devino and Tommy being killed for 
it by the Gambino family, the 1978 Lufthansa heist and the murders due to 
Burke's paranoia and greed, the drug running and Hill rolling over on the 
family by turning state's evidence. Casino is based on Frank Rosenthal, who 
ran the Stardust, Fremont, and Hacienda casinos in Las Vegas for the 
Chicago Outfit in the 70's and 80's ... as well as mafia enforcer Anthony 
Spilotro and the baseball bat beating he died from in some field. The 
Godfather is NOT based on specific people and events. However, writer Mario 
Puzo did base many of the characters on underworld players he heard about 
while growing up and working in New York City.
